search.query: index=_internal sourcetype=scheduler savedsearch_name="_ACCELERATE_DM_*" host IN ($host$) | stats values(host) as SHs dc(host) as total_hosts by savedsearch_name | sort - total_hosts

html.p: Pick one SH(C) to run the DMA, tell all others to reuse that acceleration via datamodels.conf:
html.pre: [Authentication] acceleration.source_guid = <GUID of the SH(C) running the DMA>

search.query: | rest splunk_server=$host$ /services/admin/summarization by_tstats=1 | eval summary.access_time = strftime('summary.access_time', "%F %T") | table title summary.access_count summary.access_time summary.size | eval size (GB, REST) = round('summary.size' / 1024 / 1024 / 1024, 3) | rex field=title "tstats:(?<name>.+)" | join type=left name [ search index=_introspection component=summaries | dedup host data.name | stats sum(data.total_size) as size by data.name | eval size (GB, _introspection) = round(size / 1024, 3) | fields - size | rename data.name as name] | fields - name summary.size

index=_internal source=*scheduler.log _ACCELERATE_DM_***_ACCELERATE_ host IN ($host$) | eval scheduled=strftime(scheduled_time,"%c") | eval run_time=tostring(run_time,"duration") | stats count as overall_count count(eval(status="skipped")) as skip_count latest(scheduled) as scheduled, values(host) as host, latest(run_time) as run_time latest(status) as status by savedsearch_name

table.title: wanting to see what indexes are defined, if any, and which indexes need to be added

search.query: | rest splunk_server=$host$ servicesNS/-/-/datamodel/model f=title f=displayName f=disabled f=description f=acceleration | spath input=description path=objects{}.constraints{}.search output=search | spath input=acceleration path=enabled output=accelerated | fields title displayName disabled accelerated search | search search="*`cim_*" OR search="*index`*" OR search="*indexes`*" | stats values(*) as * by title | rex field=search max_match=0 "`(?<macro>[^`]+)`" | rex field=search max_match=0 "tag=(?<tag>[^\s|\)]+)" | eval tag=mvdedup(tag) | eval macro=mvdedup(macro) | join macro type=left [| rest splunk_server=$host$ /servicesNS/-/-/configs/conf-macros | rex field=id "(?<macro>[^\/]*)$" | stats values(definition) as macro_definition by macro | search macro=cim_* OR macro=*index*]
